generated.text: Most AI coding tools operate as black boxesâ€”you can't see how they work, change how they behave, or own what you build with them. Amplifier is different: every component is inspectable, every piece is swappable, and the entire stack is yours to own and extend.

web_element.element: First feature card - Use any model

generated.title: Use any model
generated.description: The model provider is a swappable component. Amplifier's Provider Protocol translates between a unified message format and vendor-specific APIs, so you can switch between Anthropic, OpenAI, Azure, Gemini, Ollama, vLLM, or community providers without rewriting anythingâ€”your tools and workflows just work.

abstraction_layer.mechanism: Provider Protocol with unified message format

swappable_without_rewrite.evidence: All providers implement the same 5-method Protocol interface (name, get_info, list_models, complete, parse_tool_calls)

description.text: Watch it think â€” every tool call is logged, every event is visible. The kernel emits lifecycle events for all operations, captured in a full audit trail. When something breaks, you know exactly where and why.

validation.evidence_summary: The kernel philosophy mandates 'event-first' observability (KERNEL_PHILOSOPHY.md:134). Every tool call emits tool:pre/tool:post events (HOOKS_API.md:206-207). The events.jsonl file serves as a 'full audit log' capturing API calls, tool executions, and errors (session-analyst.md:380). Hook handlers can register with '*' pattern to observe ALL events (13_event_debugging.py:235).
validation.adjustments_made: Changed 'every decision' to 'every tool call' and 'every event' for precision - the kernel logs decisions that cross module boundaries and all significant operations, not internal LLM reasoning steps.

generated.text: Providers connect to any LLMâ€”Anthropic, OpenAI, Azure, Gemini, or your own local models. Tools give your agent capabilities like file access, web search, and code execution. Each piece works independently and can be swapped without touching the others, but they compose into something powerful. That's why Amplifier is a platform, not just a wrapper around someone else's API.

generated.value:
$ amplifier provider current
âœ“ Provider: anthropic (claude-sonnet-4-5)
  Model: claude-sonnet-4-5
  Max tokens: 64000

$ amplifier run "Create a hello world function in Python"

â³ Connecting to claude-sonnet-4-5...
âœ“ Session started: amp_20260130_181405

ðŸ”§ Using tool: write_file
   Path: hello.py
   Content: 12 lines

I've created a hello world function for you:

```python
def hello(name: str = "World") -> str:
    """Return a friendly greeting."""
    return f"Hello, {name}!"

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print(hello())
    print(hello("Amplifier"))
```

The function is saved to `hello.py`. Run it with:
```bash
python hello.py
```

âœ“ Session complete (1 tool call, 847 tokens)

generated.value:
---
bundle:
  name: security-reviewer
  version: 1.0.0
  description: Security-focused code review agent

includes:
  - bundle: git+https://github.com/microsoft/amplifier-foundation@main
  - bundle: security-reviewer:behaviors/security-review

agents:
  include:
    - security-reviewer:vulnerability-scanner
    - security-reviewer:compliance-checker
---

# Security Review Agent

@security-reviewer:context/security-guidelines.md

You are a security-focused code reviewer. Analyze code for:
- Authentication and authorization vulnerabilities
- Input validation issues
- Secrets exposure risks
- Dependency vulnerabilities

---

@foundation:context/shared/common-system-base.md

- Markdown content section

validation_rules.description: YAML structure must match BUNDLE_GUIDE.md specification
Must be valid YAML + Markdown

items.title: Debug in minutes
items.description: Every event flows to a single JSONL stream. Hooks provide full observability for logging, metrics, and audit trails without blocking execution.

items.title: Swap anything
items.description: Providers, tools, orchestrators, and hooks are all swappable modules. Mix and match components like LEGO bricks with stable contracts.

items.title: Share like code
items.description: Bundles are markdown with YAML frontmatterâ€”human-readable, diffable, and versionable. Load from git URLs or local files.

items.title: Your data stays yours
items.description: Run locally with Ollama, keep secrets out of version control, and store sessions on your machine. You control where data goes.

current_website_value.title: Your data stays yours

generated.text: Every bundle carries someone's approach to solving problemsâ€”their choice of tools, agents, and workflows honed through real use. Install a bundle that resonates, layer your own perspective on top, and share what you've learned back to the community. This is how the ecosystem grows: not through central planning, but through practitioners building on each other's work.

validation_rules.description: Should reflect community/sharing philosophy

content.current_website_value: Every bundle carries someone's approach to solving problems. Install theirs. Add your perspective. When you share back, you're teaching others a new way to think. The more perspectives, the smarter the community.
